GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles. Sorted by date created_at in descending order

queries.name: sort_by
queries.description: The column to sort the articles by. Defaults to 'created_at'. Can be any valid column name such as 'title', 'author', etc

queries.name: order_by
queries.description: The order in which to sort the articles. Defaults to 'desc' (descending). Can be 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending)

queries.name: topic
queries.description: Filters the articles by the specified topic. If omitted, all articles are returned.

GET /api/users.description: serves an array of all users

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an article object by its article_id

articles.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
articles.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves an array of comments for the given article_id. Sorted in descending order, with the most recent comments first

comments.author: butter_bridge
comments.body: I am 100% sure that we're not completely sure.

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: adds a comment to the specified article_id and responds with the newly created comment

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: updates the vote count for a specific article by article_id. 'inc_votes' specifies the number of votes to increment or decrement by

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Deletes a comment by the specified comment_id. Responds with status 204 and no content
